name: Shantel Ervin
text: As a cancer warrior, I have had my share of doctors appointments, treatments, surgical procedures and more. Because of this my pain threshold is high so if I say something hurts it really hurts. My previous dental office was aware of this yet the hygienist chose to ignore the pain I was experiencing. After speaking with the office manager I decided I would not complete my appointment and later called back and canceled any further treatment with that practice. I called my insurance company and located the office of a previous dentist that I loved and I am so glad I did. I called Bryant Dental on Bob Wallace and even the interaction over the phone was pleasant. Whitney was able to schedule me an appointment quickly and educated me on the processes and procedures and what to expect. I could hear her smile through the phone. The day of my appointment, the entire staff was absolutely wonderful! As a new patient for the practice I knew I would have paperwork and would probably be there for a while but as soon as I finished my paperwork my hygienist was waiting for me. Chelsey greeted me with smiling eyes (she had on her mask), explained the process in depth and after reviewing my x-rays she recommended the best next step to help with my issues. She listened and made sure to understand what I was experiencing and throughout my appointment she made sure the process was not causing too much pain. With tender swollen gums pain is to be expected however if the hygienist knows what they are doing the patient will experience minimal pain. Chelsey knows what she is doing! She took a potentially mouth throbbing, tears running uncomfortable situation and made it a pleasant and educational experience. I went in with my mouth feeling awful and because of what Chelsey did my teeth feel so much better. Because I am a cancer warrior my teeth and gums have gone through some major changes. Chemo, radiation and long term medication has caused damage that I thought was going to take radical treatment to repair but Chelsey explained how to minimize further damage and what to do to get me on a path of recovery. She was absolutely amazing! I highly recommend Bryant Dental on Bob Wallace, you will not be disappointed.

resp.text: Wow to that wonderful review!  We are so happy to hear about your great experience with us!  We will pass these sweet words you shared on to the staff and especially let Chelsey and Whitney know :)

name: Colleen Sauls
text: Let me save some of you the trouble. They use Transworld System collection agency when Tonya makes a mistake with your treatment plan and tells you your insurance will pay half and you pay the other half ($560) and then it turns out TONYA read it wrong but expects the patient to pay for her mistake you will get turned over to a collection agency! I liked Dr. Bentley and was very disappointed she let her office manager get away with dirty office practices, so I had no other choice but to find another dentist for my son and I. Tonya wouldn’t let me speak to Dr. Bentley she twisted what happened to fit her narrative and let Dr.Bentley think they were doing me a favor by cutting the bill in half when all along Tonya knows this is on her! And she sent a $240 bill to collections on a procedure that wasn’t even done correctly (we were told my son didn’t need a crown turns out he did but because of Tonyas error reading our policy which is her job by the way we never went back to Dr.Bentley after getting a $500 bill in the mail no phone call Tonya knew I would be upset and she knew exactly what she told me) and the tooth had to be extracted after all of that! So NO  I do not recommend you go there! Not because of Dr. Bentley but because you cannot trust Tonya to do your insurance and billing correctly! Do you have an extra $1000.00  laying around when you get a surprise bill from Tonya? When I asked Tonya why she didn’t catch that the insurance wouldn’t cover that procedure she said to me well neither did you! Wow!! Tonya claimed to have gotten an approval for the procedure when all along root canals weren’t covered within the first year of coverage (so that was a lie to cover her mistake) I would have thought an office manager and the person who is supposed to verify insurance would check that first thing! I have never had this happen before over 30 years of taking myself and 2 kids to the dentist! So there you have it! Chelsea & Jennifer are great though!

resp.text: So sorry Colleen that there was any issue with your time with us at Bryant dental.  Unfortunately with insurance they always have the disclaimer that it is an estimate and not a guarantee of payment.  As a courtesy we strive to help our patients by handling all the dental billing rather than collecting all payments up front for procedures creating the hassle for the patient to handle all billing to his or her own insurance.  It's a partnership where we rely on what the insurance provides us and what the insurance provides to the patient about their own coverage.  We definitely do our best on our end to try to gather all the information about waiting periods, missing tooth clauses and percentages covered.  We will look into your account and see what happened in your situation.  Once again we apologize you had anything but the best experience with us!

name: Jeffrey Smith
text: Just returned from having a root canal at the Huntsville office..Terrible experience...assistant didn't introduce herself so I couldn't tell you her name or the dentist because he didn't either (when we were leaving my wife found out it was Dr. Willis)..no tell me what's going on or anything..I passed on info from previous dentist as was told to do but was quickly dismissed with we don't do that..just you need to see a specialist...how about what type of specialist? I informed them that cold water really hurts my teeth and dentist said, "Really nothing I can do about it unless I numb your mouth."  In addition, I told both that it does not feel numb where you put the shots..most dentists would probably give you another shot to help..not this one (wasn't even offered anesthesia)...of course they sprayed cold water in my mouth and I jumped you may need to know...dentist says I can't do anything if you jump to which I replied "That is why I told you prior to starting about what you may need to know!" Sprayed cold water in mouth and it sprayed all over my face no goggles and never wiped off my face.  Dentist went back and forth with me on why I was telling him anything about cold water or numbness..after getting through it there was no what to do if I experience pain afterwards, wife had to go back in and ask.  I found the dentist and assistant very rude and unprofessional.

resp.text: So sorry to hear you didn't have a great experience with us Jeffrey!  This definitely doesn't sound like the experience we want for any of our patients or that we typically have as our normal feedback.  I will reach out to the office manager and she will contact you.  We always want to create a wonderful experience for all our patients and will look into this complaint.

Cigna did pay them for the services, but Bryant wants even more than what a cleaning and exam are. Under Cigna in network plan the cleanings and exam are 100 percent covered. text: I agree with jade... i am a severe Dentaphobe and called to change dentists after a bad experience with my other dentist.  My first visit was ok, but something seemed off. He says I don't  need it and after several minites, gives me the nitrox, but does not give it time to work. He then drills pokes and grinds, while I am crying. . They fit the temp crown and say I can pay when they put new crown on. I am then in  PAIN for 3 weeks. I go back in he says he wants to put me on steroids and pain meds, but he may have to do a root canal.  They will check to see how I am and setup another appointment.  NEVER HAPPENED.  got a bill in the mail for my crown that I never got... when I called them, their number listed on bill was disconnected. Can you say, "" you know a good attorney? "

text: Love this place! I had to have a gum graft and Dr. Lane was amazing! He told me that I would only need a couple days of pain pills and I just kept thinking there’s no way because they took a graft from the back of my mouth and put in on my front teeth but he was right! Him and his whole staff made the whole process easy. His staff is extremely nice and welcoming! I recommend him to anyone that needs dental work done!

name: Louise Meyers
text:
Everything, literally, about my experience from start to finish has been excellent! Dr. Lane is a true exceptional professional; always on time with appointments, excellent communication and taking initiative on follow up. His office staff is expedient, kind, and always treated me like I was their only patient even though it is a very busy office.

Dr. Lane did gum grafts for me as well as the removal of tooth and bone, bone graftings, insertion of post and ct scans to make sure each step of the way was working well. In this ten-month process, I have never had even one disappointment. He called me at home to check on me after the bone grafts, gum grafts, and post insertion. His collaboration with my dentist, who will finish the crown work, is seamless.

He is always kind, not just to me, but he frequently thanks his staff for their assistance. I highly recommend Dr. Lane for any periodontal work and I was so glad I was referred to him.

text: Great experience the last few years after my gum surgery. They were always friendly but professional. My hygienist was wonderful. I really appreciate all the care they provided. I would highly recommend them.

name: Kristie Williams
text:
This is by far the BEST experience I've ever had with any doctors office...ever! Everyone was friendly, they were on time and very helpful. Dr. Lane was thorough, considerate, personable, and knowledgeable. He asked questions out of basic consideration that should be everyday practice in a doctor's office. I kept thinking "What a great question, why have I never been asked that before?!" I highly recommend!!
Post surgery update: Dr. Lane corrected a receding gum for me with a gum graft. Dr. Lane asked me how much I wanted to know before giving me too much or not enough detail which was wonderful because I want to know it all and sometimes don't know what to ask. Going into the procedure I knew exactly what to expect and the only thing I expected that didn't happen was the pain. This procedure and recovery was surprisingly painless, I was sore but never enough to require pain medicine. Also, Dr. Lane was very clear that there was no guarantee for total root coverage, but 2 weeks out I have total root coverage and the results look wonderful. I still 100% recommend Dr. Lane!!

text:
I went to this dentist close when they first opened up.
They really really damaged my mouth.
They said they did 3 fillings but really did four... Not only that but they drilled to far and unfortunately i had to have all of them pulled. I had 3 surgeries trying to correct their mistake before we just had them pulled. i did try to reach out to them but when i called expressing something was wrong the lady in the front wouldnt listen and instead said they would look at it but in a month and said we needed to try and get the others. I had to then switch dentists and since then im terrified to even attempt to get something as small as a filling.

name: Starr Lehner
text:
While I was saying wrong tooth she kept pulling stating she'll get it. I asked why won't it come out. She stated she'll get it.
So she pulled the good tooth and left decayed abcessed tooth beside it.
Wouldn't let me see tooth she pulled.
Had to go to another dentist who very easily pulled decayed tooth. He asked why she pulled wrong tooth.
When partial I've had more than 30 yrs wouldn't fit back I stated maybe because when you pulled tooth the others moved. Oh no that didn't happen. So she grinded on my partial making it for first time ever loose.
Well went back to get partial and they added a metal loop and wrapped it around another decayed tooth. Recently found out (from Dr)acid reflux quickly ruined my teeth. Always was complimented on my teeth and the care I took. So of course it broke off completely.
Of course Signature Smile wants their co-pay money. I sent what I could. Still I suffer. No apology.
Since the ordeal I've dealt with parotid gland pain.
I'm sure because I'm poor and on Medicare (cancer) I just don't meet their standard of a wealthy christian person so it doesn't matter. Wish I could post pictures of my mouth and what I live with because of them.

resp.text:
Starr,

We have tried contacting you directly regarding your review. Our records regarding the visits you mentioned are from 2017 and 2018, and we have documented consents for the treatment you requested. You also have recurring visits for comprehensive care after the treatment was completed, with no complaints or regard for any issues you mentioned in your review. We are happy to discuss this with you further. Our main priority is to give patients high quality care for their dental health and needs. We hope to hear from you soon!

Signature Smile

name: Chris K. Northington
text: I can not say enough good things about Dr. Wilson and his staff at Signature Smile.  They are without a doubt the best Dental practice I have ever been to.  We turned to them to fix my wife's implants/crowns when no-one else in the area could make them look right.  From the moment we walked in the door, we were greeting with compassion and understanding, and assured that they could fix her crowns.  They immediately scheduled an appoint for that same week to do her evaluation.  In that first appointment, Dr. Wilson laid out exactly what needed to be done, gave us a time frame for the work to be completed with cost estimates, and hand made her a set of temporaries that looked better than any of the final crowns from the other dentists we had worked with.  He performed laser dentistry on her gums to give her a bigger smile, used the KOR whitening system to give her a bright white color to her teeth, and put on two new crowns that he gets from a lab in Hollywood, CA.  I can proudly say today that my wife has a beautiful smile that she is so proud of thanks to the work of Dr. Wilson and his staff at Signature Smiles.  They are now offering laser filings that can be done with no numbing or drilling.  If you are a new patient, they offer a free Smile Evaluation that includes a panoramic X-ray.  I have referred many customers to them because of my belief in the work they do.

name: L “lalani wuto” M
text: I have had several occasions to visit Dr. Wilson's dental practice.  I have not ever had less than a wonderful experience.  From cleaning to root canal services, I have had comfortable, painless, and easy sessions with Dr. Wilson and the staff.  He utilizes the latest technology including laser, easy and non invasive X-Ray sessions, and new ways of imagery when viewing bone structure.  I want to also send accolades to the front reception area as well.  The associates are so very friendly and helpful.  They were a great help with my insurance questions and very helpful on every thing I needed as far as administrative information.  I have never had to wait too long for my appointments and felt like I was always visiting family.

name: Mary Robinson
text:
I recently won a Sheer Whitening Gift Certificate at Blue valued at $149. I scheduled my appointment with the dental rep and asked what I could expect. She told me to plan to be there about an hour. They would clean, polish and then give me the Sheer Whitening treatments. Wow, I thought, pretty good prize. I proceeded to ask what kind of whitening treatments they used, 5 day strips, ugh, I thought, oh well.

Unfortunately, I arrived for my appointment about 10 minutes late, however, not intentional. The receptionist was a bit unfriendly and I thought maybe it was because I was late. Shortly, a dental assistant came to me with a clip board and 5 pages to fill out. I completed my basic information and soon realized they were wanting more info than was totally necessary to claim a prize. I began scanning over the pages and stopped immediately. They were asking me everything from signing to consent to pay for the charges they would render to me today and insurance could not be filed to authorizing them to obtain my dental records from my current dentist. I proceeded to the receptionist and told her there was obviously a mistake, I was asked to fill out patient paperwork and that I was only there to redeem my gift certificate. She told me to proceed completing the paperwork so that they could keep it on file. I looked at her in disbelief and sat back down placing the pen under the clip. I guess she signaled the assistant who came out and retrieved my paperwork. I waited for over 30 minutes before they called me back. I followed the assistant back to a dental room and she handed me a box of strips and about 5 minutes of instruction. Do you have any questions? I said, "Are we done?", she said yes that's it. Hmm, so they led me to believe that the cleaning and polishing were part of my prize when really they were going to bill me for this when they were finished. I guess I didn't fall for their trap. Talk about deceitful, a good reputable business does not do business this way. I will not be back. I will still use my strips, but could have got them at Wal-mart for $12.00. What a joke. Watch out?

name: Sharon Foust-Mills (Sharon)
text: Great dentist. Had to get a tooth removed when root canal from a previous dentist went bad. He understands that you might be on a limited budget, he's straight forward about the priorities needing repaired.

name: Charlotte C
text: I'm giving this place one star ONLY because this program requires it to leave a rating.  BAD DENTIST.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY!!! This dentist is BAD!  First of all he is VERY rough.  The front desk personnel AND the dentist have a BAD attitudes - perhaps being married and working together all day every day is not a good idea.  This dentist's hand are so big which causes even more problems for someone with a tiny mouth.  I had a filling replaced here, within a day it was obvious that something wasn't right so I returned to this dentist to have it repaired, he made an adjustment and after a week I was still having discomfort, when I called to get back in they couldn't fit me in right away and I had to travel out of town for a couple of months, as time went by the discomfort turned to PAIN.  When I returned home I made an appointment with a DIFFERENT dentist office to have the tooth/filling looked at - the filling was cracked and missing parts in 3 places and when this new dentist started taking it out - it was obvious that the filling material never set up properly as the filling was soft.  I would NEVER go to this dentist again for anything!!!!  AND they have very bad business practices because they refuse to give me a refund!  Perhaps it is time for him to retire!!!!!!!!  BAD DENTIST!!!

text: Wonderful experience at Dr. Hart’s office!  Thorough check ups, great communication on billing and benefits, and painless dental work for my little ones!

text: I do not recommend. I'm not sure what has happened since the previous reviews but it was not clean, cluttered and crunched into a tiny exam room, my husband and I both had appointments. The assistant was untrained and unfamiliar with the supplies he needed. Dr. Hart moved very slowly, bluntly placed the instruments on our chest in between using them, the exam and cleaning were both, the most painful and least thorough we've had. We drove 2 hours for a holistic dentist, not what their website portrays. If Dr. Hart is ill or they have fallen on hard times...God bless them but; the patient shouldn't be the one to suffer.

text: I usually go to Dr. Hart for the regular cleanings and check up. I like how welcoming his staff is from the moment you walk in. Everyone's nice an they do great dental work.

name: Dave Smith
text: Great Dentist, I am a snow bird, broke a filling and he was able to get me right in. He was great. Very fast no pain could no ask for a better Dentist office.

name: Omar Chong
text: I called, asked a question about pricing, I believe Mr.Hart answered, he said I don’t know in a horrible tone and then proceeded to tell me to call back later because he was going to lunch.

name: Boat Man
text: As always I was treated with the utmost respect and given the care that any patient should expect. Thank you for what you do.

name: Liliia USA
text: My husband was a client of this clinic for several years. And he came from Pensacola. Last week, the VA was allowed to give him another apoitment.  My husband called and left a voice message.  A few hours later , he got a call back, as it turned out, from the clinic. My husband receives thousands of calls from various Scam and advertising companies. And this call he credited to the Scam and did not respond properly. When he realized that there was a misunderstanding, he called back again, deeply apologized. That's it!!! Since then, silence!!!! I , his wife , called, WA called. Expensive clinic and a wonderful doctor! You need to change the receptionist.  A clinic that works to provide services should probably at least answer incoming calls.

name: Jackilynn Langley
text: Most amazing place! They care!

name: B A Buckland
text: Very intelligent, thoughtful and caring. Congenial and authentic. Knows how to do his job. Would recommend him to anyone needing a peridontist or implants.

name: Antonio Md
text: Really nice and friendly staff. Book ahead of time because appointments full quickly!

name: Ross Isbell
text: Our practice often refers patients to Dr. Sims and team and they always are thankful for a great experience!

name: Carolyn Bryant
text: My dentist sent me to Dr. Kevin Sims for dental implants. Dr. Sims and team made welcome immediately. He was glad to answer all my questions and explain procedures so that I could understand him. I have several visits more before I am through, but I am very impressed with him and the clinic as a whole. I anticipate having a fabulous outcome and a beautiful smile.

name: Frank Thacker
text: I have used many dentist in my 64yrs. Dr. Sims has pleased me more than any other. The implants are AWESOME and the procedure was relatively pain free... The fact that He thought of my procedure and personally called me at home just to check meant a lot to me... I believe He takes every patients procedure personally and truly cares for their well being.... Thank You Dr. Sims for making my life better....

name: Barry Harrison
text: Dr. Sims and his staff are amazing! From the first time I called , they were nothing but nice. I worked with them for almost a year from a bone graft to dental implants. After my surgeries Dr. Sims called me himself to check on me. Ginny was usually his dental assistant and was always so nice and caring !  The dental implants have changed my life ! I highly recommend DR. Sims to anyone !

name: Douglas Duet
text: Amazing. Courteous, professional and super friendly

name: Lindy McCullers Carmichael
text: The whole team is fabulous!

name: Joyce Cooper
text: Scheduled  appointments are meant with little to no wait time. The office staff are always professional and courteous. All procedures are fully explained. I would definitely recommend.

name: Jasmine “Jassie Creations” Neal
text: Clean and friendly place. The staff was nice and my cleaning was good. I will continue to go.

name: Anoymous Ok
text: Can someone tell me why their is not a full time receptionist to answer the phone.

name: Lena Dillon
text: Cumberland Dental takes excellent care of my dental needs.

name: Dorothy Johnson
text: I like the service, staff was very nice and generous I'm looking forward to my next visit.   Thank you.

name: Becky Shirley
text: My mother had to have a crown replaced. They told her a price and what her part was going to cost. She paid it right then. After 2 months the procedure was finished, why it took 2 months is beyond me. They are now sending her bills for more money even after the insurance company has paid their part too. Also charged the insurance company for 2 tooth crowns and not just one.

name: BJ Kidd
text: Terrible experience.  Unorganized.  Worked on the correct tooth for one family member but applied Novocain shots to the wrong side of the mouth.  Performed a filling that is failing only after a couple of months.  Another family member sat in the Dentists chair for 2 hours and 30 min without performing any work.  Billing was also a headache very difficult to work with and a confusing bill.  Complete waste of time and money.

name: Keith Foshee
text: Was referred to this place by my Dental Insurance Company.    Called at  3 various times during business hours and got answering service every time.    Very little command of English language.    Left message on 3rd try for someone to please call me back to schedule an appointment.    24 Hours have passed and still no call.    If this is an indication of how they run the business- then I wouldn't do business with them anyway.    So very unprofessional.

name: kash05052010
text: Anita is awesome! She’s sweet and does her job well!!

name: Amberlyn Porter
text: Tammy was my dental hygienist and she was amazing. I absolutely love how comfortable and aware she made me in the time of my visit. This place is definitely home for me!

name: James Mucha
text: From the front counter upon entering the facility, to the dental hygienist, to Dr. White, I received phenomenal service and a thorough exam. Staff were very friendly and professional. I know what to expect each and every visit and have never been disappointed. I will continue my dental care at Cumberland.

name: Kindeth Martin
text: Very rude unprofessional group. I called to get a bill resolved because they did not file my insurance, (which I gave them the correct insurance card at the time of my appointment), she told me she'd have to send my information to corporate, (which was suppose to be done at my appointment) and I told her I didn't care what they had to do, I just wanted my bill resolved, I got hung up on. I called back, I asked for a supervisor, I was told a supervisor would call me, (mind you none of my information was asked for) I asked her is she was gonna take my information, in a smart tone she said "We have called ID", I explained to her I was calling from work and wanted them to call me back on my cell phone, well then she proceeded to remember who I was. Please do not waste your time here, they do not care about you nor your health and the also will not allow you to make payments on your bill. Go to someone who cares because its obviously not this group.

name: LWV Tuscaloosa
text: I have been going to Cumberland Dental for 8 years.  Right after I moved to Tuscaloosa the front half of a molar broke off.  I picked Cumberland Dental from the Yellow Pages, found that it takes my dental insurance and got a prompt appointment with Dr. White.  He made a crown for the tooth that is completely satisfactory after 8 years.  He has replaced a couple of old fillings and the new ones are fine.  Emily, the hygienist who takes care of my routine visits, is really competent, professional and friendly.  I certainly would recommend both of them to anyone.

name: Raymond C
text: There is a long wait time between visits but Dr White is excellent. He does not hurt you when he gives the numbing shot. The assistants are mostly nice. However whoever they call in to do tooth extractions will hurt you. I wish Dr. White would teach them how to give a shot.

name: Alethia Smith
text: This is the worst dentist ofice, to go too! The woman that did my cleaning, had a nasty and unprofessional attitude. She didn't speak to me or ask how i was doing and act like she really hated her job. I want EVER go back there. So please stop emailing me..for a follow up on my cleanings. I have never ever experienced such bad attitudes in my whole life on earth. The equipment , looks horrible and looks old. I can go on. I should of left as soon as i meet the woman that i dealt with. She looked so mean and unhelpful. You all want ever have to worry about me EVER again. I wasn't comfortable at all in there.She acted like she was even more mad, because i had braces on and that i just needed to get a cleaning. They need to fire her. She is one of the main reasons..you all or getting bad business. Please get more educated and professional workers in there. Its like going to hell and back, going there straight up.  People, please take my advice and don't waste your money or time!!!!!! No stars, none whats so ever! I'm still pissed off. Hate i had to even like one star...to submit this post.

name: Sheila Garner
text: I have had a wonderful experience!!!! Couldn’t ask for better service, friendly and helpful staff! Staff takes time to answer questions that you may have, I highly recommend them!!!

name: Mary Black
text: Every one is caring and they took great Care of my needs. I have high anxiety and they were great helping me stay calm etc.

name: Sherri Custred
text: Came here for implant surgery. Am now 5 MONTHS BEHIND schedule because their implant dentist and scheduler can't seem to get things right. I have rearranged my schedule to be here 5 TIMES and been told I have to reschedule. As soon as I am finished here,  I WILL NEVER COME TO THIS OFFICE AGAIN. IF I HADN'T MADE THE MISTAKE OF PAYING FOR ALL OF MY PROCEDURES I WOULDN'T EVER COME BACK!

name: Shamaria Borden
text: The first visit wasn't bad at all. The lady who did my cleaning was very informative and nice. However, I have been rescheduled 3 consecutive times for my cavities to be filled. Whoever this lady is, who's supposed to perform my fillings, has been out of the office seems for months now. My rescheduled appts. have now ran into a 3 month period. It's extremely frustrating. I have chosen to switch dentists.

name: Kimberly Johnson
text: They make you feel comfortable during your stay, I was very impressed with the care that I had!! I would definitely refer anyone to Cumberland dental!!!

name: Js Bell
text: Everyone was very nice and professional. Procedure was quick and painless.😊

name: Sandi Moss
text: Horrible! Worst place to ever go!!!! I was charged for some procedures twice one procedure I didn't need at all! I wear a medical bracelet AND my file list my allergies in BOLD LETTERS and the dentist completely overlooked it proceeded to touch me. Ihad to leave and spend 2 days in the hospital because my throat began to close! I DO NOT ADVISE ANYONE TO GO HERE AT ALL!

name: Kat Robison Hasani
text: Waited over an hour and after showing up early and still hadn’t seen the actual dentist and they couldn’t even say when the dentist would be in. We left. Worst dental experience ever.

name: Ashley Delahanty
text: I'm 30, I've had a lot of dental work in my life and the oral surgeon is the first to actually make me cry. She was so rough and to top it off, I still have pieces of tooth sticking out of my gum causing a lot of discomfort. My experience was so unpleasant, I don't even want to go back for her to check on it

name: Cheryl Farley
text: I have been a customer of Dr. White's for over thirty years.  I always refer people looking for a dentist. Also my dental hygienist Montana and Dr. White really care about they patient's. 👍

name: Shalandra Washington
text: Ms. Anita is awesome. This last visit was great and very timely.

name: Natalie Davis
text:
Normally I go to the dentist at home but it was an emergency. I woke up one morning with a lot of pain and swelling. I went in and they gave me some antibiotics and ask I return to have the tooth fixed on completion of my antibiotics. The service from this visit was great!
I returned on completion of my antibiotics and that's when the trouble started. They decided I needed to get a root canal on the tooth. It was still very sensitive and painful. The hygienist was very general when taking x-Rays and getting me into my room. The dentist came in and put a bit of numbing medication on my gums. The shot was done before the gum was numb and he started the dental work before the tooth was numb. He would not stop no matter what the hygentist or I did. I walked out of the office in tears and it wasn't until I got to my car the full effect of the numbing medication kicked in. The office staff and hygentist all seemed very upset about how the doctor did this. Needless to say I did not return to have my permanent crown done at this office and for purposes of all emergencies will seek care elsewhere!

name: Jackie Easterwood
text: EVERYONE is always friendly to me i like that the wait time is not long

name: Deborah Crocker
text: I have been going there for 25 years. Some of the personnel have changed over the years but I have never had a problem with anyone or anything.

name: D Pohl
text: Dishonest and predatory practices.  Completely unsatisfactory.  Complaint filed with the Better Business Bureau.

name: Earl Ike-German
text: Awesome staff!! Anita and Dr. White are the best!!

name: Donna Lockett
text: Don't think I would recommend anyone here..the nusrse that took my xrays was so harsh with the tools she had to do it with and my tongue still hurts and she smelled like a pack of cigarettes.. Then they said I had to schedule two appointment to do the work they need to do.but I think this office just want money...#Needs major improvements

name: Temeka Johnson
text: My experience with Cumberland Dental was awful, I had to go back several times for work that was done to be  done over again, like my filling came out within 2 or 3 day after being put in then when I went back he stuck a needle n my gum where I had no teeth at now that spot is hurting so bad I don't know what to do and the filling has came out again

name: Kristin Heard
text: I went to this dentist and they told me I had 100 cavities. Of Course I went to get a second opinion because I thought 100 cavities was absurd. Once I received a second opinion from a different dentist office,  I was then told I didn't have any.

name: Mike Howell
text: My experience here was good.. Dr. White and the staff treated me well and my problem was taken care of..

name: Michael Morris
text: They do good work at good prices.

name: Gail Johnson
text: Everything was great, staff was very polite.

name: Jayy Hollie
text: Horrible, Horrible Customer Service!!

name: Mickey Burgin
text: The pain was gone a couple of hours after I left

text: Copy Comments To Clipboard
